description:
《英乐天天唱》是一档模仿唱歌类节目，目的在于提升大家的英语口语能力。主持人会在每期节目中选取好听的歌曲片段，并给出发音提示和模仿示例。喜欢听音乐的童鞋可要积极参与哦！去沪江部落订阅本节目！

乐队成立是2004年科罗拉多州，几个成员都是受Ryan Tedder所影响，贝斯手Meyers，吉他手Filkins、Drew Brown，鼓手Eddie Fischer。
2006年OneRepublic的天使专辑打破哥伦比亚纪录。

title: 英文歌曲天天唱：Counting stars

description:
Today marks the beginning of the latest round of transatlantic trade and investment partnership negotiations in Brussels. TTIP, as it is known, has been raising passions on both sides of the Atlantic. The landmark deal would create the world's biggest free trade area, spanning North America and Europe. Supporters say it would boost the economies and create employment of all the countries involved. It could be worth almost $100 billion a year to the European Union alone, say TTIP fans. But campaigners have a whole raft of concerns, including the impact of new powers it could give corporations over nation-states. They also fear any deal could undermine regulation of everything from food standards to financial services. To discuss TTIP, I'm joined from Brussels by Markus Beyrer, director general of BusinessEurope, and John Hilary, executive director of the campaign group War on Want. So Markus, let's start with you. You're a supporter of TTIP. Why would it be good for business?

Well, I think it's not only good for business. It's good for the whole European people. First, I think this is the best chance we have got to create extra growths and extra jobs. Second, as globalisation is happening and this will continue to happen, it's the best chance we've got to shape this globalisation according to our values, western values.
